comment: He is a great professor. Participation matters in maths.

Some think prof is a little fast but I thought it was a little slow. He will make weird noises if people aren't paying attention and can be condescending about it. Lots of homework, sometimes 20+ topics on ALEKS. Attendance isn't mandatory but you will be lost if you miss sessions. Bonus pts for

Pretty good class, Just make sure you make it to every lecture because if you don't you will be lost. He's pretty good with communicating. Work was pretty easy if you knew what you were doing. Print or download Lecture notes!!!

He's an ok teacher, literally just go to class because quantitative reasoning isn't even a hard math, you just need to go to class. I do recommend downloading or printing every class notes. But all and all he was ok.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment:
I have always been terrible at math, but this professor made it easy to follow along 

I believe we have used ALEK? The homework assignments over there rlly helped me!

He provided study guides for each of the tests and the final exam!Also the final exam replaces the lowest test grade(If the final surpasses it)

I haven'tstressed out in this class!

Prof Burnham made this course both enjoyable and manageable. As long as you show up, do the weekly ALEKS assignments and take lecture notes (guided print-outs are available on D2L), you will do well. He explains the material in a way that is clear and understandable, and I felt that he genuinely cared about student success. Take this class!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Just show up, pay attention, do your weekly homework module and you're good. He's very chill. Very straight forward class, never confusing and he is very open to asking questions. I am math minded so having him as a teacher made this course easy, but he breaks down the content and explains what he does without skipping any steps and is very clear.
Prof Burnham is a super easy prof, he easily outlines course materials. Tests are exactly like his homework, and his reviews are super similar to exams! Great prof!!

This guy has been nothing but a pain! He literally doesn't answer any questions in class and actually gets mad at you for even asking! He gives random quizzes and assignments trying to relate them back to math in ways that are convoluted and don't make sense. If you miss a class, good luck cause he's not helping.

He makes everything easy to understand and very digestible. I've been lost in many other math classes, especially in highschool, but he makes it so I know exactly what I'm learning and why. If you're on the fence, definitely take him!

Was a good professor.  Not much opportunity for extra credit and few in class assignments. Homework every week and four test total. He was very helpful and good at his job, I just wasn't good at the class.

Professor Burnham is a great professor, he goes slow and ensures everyone has comprehension of the material. If someone doesn't, all they need to do is raise their hand and be brave enough to voice their confusion. You can talk to him after class about it or go to his office hours. Completing the ALEKS work helps immensely in understanding.

I took Professor Burnham for two courses, and I highly recommend him! His PreCal class can be challenging but that is if you don't put a lot of effort in. He is very accessible if you ever need help. Gives 3 points on tests if you complete the study guide (so you can get a 103). Class consists of 4 tests, a final, Weekly ALEKS work, & participation

I loved him! He is an amazing person and professor, and he is very lenient and understanding in how he distributes his points. The ALEKS homework is annoying, but the study guide was the best way to study for the tests, along with the videos he made going over the study guide. He's amazing!

For the most part Professor B was a great teacher when it came to teaching and making sure students understand. Extra credit (3pts) on each test. I didn't like the pop up group activities so if you didn't go to class a certain day and it happens to be a day that it was a in class/group activity, you'll get a 0 so go to class as much as possible.

I loved taking his class hes a great professor and is good at explaining everything. He really cares about his students and wants to help out. The class itself is relatively easy but he made it so much easier and better. would definitely recommend taking him.

Easy class and great professor. He is very passonionated and wants you to particpate in class. All HW is on ALEKS. 5 tests which are in person and you can get +3 extra credit for each test if you do the study guide. Notecard for every test. Lowest test will be dropped by final.

I took Prof. Burnham for algebra and he was also a 10/10 professor in that class. Then over the summer I took a different professor over the summer and he was horrible. Im now taking prof. Burnham again for pre calc now, he makes it make so much more sense. The class is whats difficult, note cards aren't allowed because thats the standard.

I have always struggled with math especially algebra but ended with an A+ in his class. He is really good at making sure you understand and offers in class assignments that really helps your grade. He allows a notecard for all exams and gives points on test just for showing your work. Take his class if it is open.

Run as fast as u can. I took in-person Precalculus. Don't stay past Drop/Add week. This is a very fast paced class & he is not good at teaching. Every class u learn like 7 concepts & they are not always related to each other. Gives in-class work randomly. Tests & quizzes are only in person, no notecards allowed, & you are expected to memorize a lot
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Burnham was the best math teacher I have ever had. He is very thorough with how he explains the materials and truly wants us to understand, you can tell he isn't just here for the pay check. Lots of opportunities for extra credit, just show up, participate, do the HW (that takes like an hour) and you'll be good! 10/10 best professor.

I liked this professor however because it was over the summer classwork was crammed. It's very important that you complete each environment check correctly to prevent deductions on your tests.. he also provides many extra credit opportunities.. also be mindful of the academic honor so that you don't get reported!! wishing you a great semester.
Very weird about online classes vs. in-person classes. He takes points for every little thing is very tedious and unfair with points and deductions. Better to take his class in person.

Very chill but fair professor. He provided lecture notes for each unit and did them in class. A lot of the course work was done through ALEKS, but as long as you do things early you won't get overwhelmed. He also had very open office hours and recommended the SMART Center early on. Definitely a good choice if math isn't your strong suit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Great!

Burnham is a great guy. He's funny so his lectures aren't boring for someone like me who hates math. He is also a great professor, he actually cares to make sure his students understand what they are learning. This was the first math class where I actually feel like I retained the information that was taught to me. However he does have pop quizzes.

Great professor. There are 4 tests + a final, and the final can replace 1 test. Tests cover 3 topics, and the difficulty increases over the semester. Easy to get 3 points of extra credit on every test and final. He LOVES participation, so take one for the team and answer the questions! Easy pop quizzes early in the semester but none at the end. ,
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is a lot of work, but he is very helpful. I am horrible at math, but he made this class understandable as long as you go to class. Very kind guy as well.

Professor Burnham made this class relatively easy! His in-class lectures were just over the class notes, displayed on D2L, and the homework correlated with the notes. His tests were open notes (a small index card) but were pretty similar to the study guide! If you do the work, then it's fairly easy! He's also super understanding and flexible!

He is not the worst professor, however as someone who enjoys math he made it very difficult to learn. His precal class moved very fast and it's hard to actually understand the material because he has lecture notes, 3 topics for each test. Aleks will have you do problems in a way that he would not on the test. Following the topics you have a test.

Professor Burnham was amazing. Please please take his course if you need to take math. He is very easy, tries his best to help students, and is genuinely a good teacher. This class was really easy if you just do the ALEKS so don't worry about it at all if you have him as a professor. Take him!

Mr. Burnham is a pretty cool instructor. He's nice and very prompt with email responses. He does do his best to help you understand a problem if you're not grasping it or get stuck. I'm not sure the class is easy per se. It depends on how well you understand and grasp the material. I did have to use outside sources to further help me. You may not!
One of the best professors at KSU! Definitely take him if you have trouble with math! Great person and very understanding and caring. Offers ways to improve overall grade too.

honestly, I didn't show up for any classes after the first few because the material was easy. his grading was clear cut, he left all assignments open throughout the semester, and tests were simple and easy. he did yell at people who weren't replying to him, which in itself was diva but overall cool guy.

Prof was great! He did hate when students had AirPods or headphones in which was understandable. But definitely cares about students doing well, constantly extending deadlines and answers emails QUICK. Take him if you can

this guy is a great teacher. this was my third attempt in precal and i just passed with a 97. the way he teaches the math will actually make you be able to understand and learn the material. you will have to learn the math to pass the test, and attend class to learn, but very lenient with deadlines as long as you communicate. he does use aleks
He likes participation so always try and participate or he gets a bit grumpy.

I love Professor Burnham. The class is easy, but I took AP Statistics in high school. He cares about each student and makes it almost impossible for you to fail. He takes lessons very slow and frequently asks if anyone needs help and understands. I honestly would take math AGAIN as an art major if it meant i had his class!!

Honestly probably one of the best teachers. The class itself is already easy, mostly cause I was in Calc 2 in HS, but nonetheless if you come straight from a pre calc in HS it'll be a breeze. He pretty much holds your hands throughout the entire semester, and I mean that in a good way. He goes really slowly and explains everything

I love his way of teaching, he takes it slow and you can tell he cares for his students. The math is pretty easy especially if you show up to class and print the guided-notes he provides. He also allows you a note card for each test which helps a lot. I would 100% recommend you take him if you can.

Professor Burnham was one of the easiest classes and he gave plenty of opportunities to correct your grade, there was homework due every week but it was super easy and unlimited attempts. He allows a notecard for every test which makes it impossible to fail. He provided extra credit at the end of the course.

He was an amazing teacher and helped the class be able to understand the course easily!! Just pay attention and you'll get an easy A if you retain information well and use your resources he gives you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: GREAT PROFESSOR! I took him after failing math twice my freshman year and this time around I was able to pass math with a A. I'm not good at math but the way he teaches as long as you pay attention in class, do homework, and ask questions if you need help you will do great. He is caring about students and allows you to learn and engage within class

ATTENDENCE He is so well at explaining things, this class is super easy but he makes understating math easier. He's real strict with attendance, if he notices not a lot of people are in class he'll do a POP QUIZ but its like something random like your fav color or fav animal. He makes clear on what you're being tested on.

Everyone before hand was already telling me that this class would be difficult. Im currently halfway done with the course and Proffesor Burnham makes this class so easy. Please take this class if your not that good with math and/or work fulltime. He cares about students doing well and you can tell he wants everyone to pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Loved taking his class, def recommend it. Very easy, as long as you do all hw and study guides!!! The study guides help so much during the test.

He is an AMAZING professor! He made math easy for me. He wasted no time during lectures, so if he was done teaching before the time he will end class. You get study guides and extra credit for completing them. He is super understanding and lenient with due dates of certain assignments. Great guy all around if I could take him again I would :)

Most of the HW is on Aleks while he says attendance is mandatory he does understand that things happen. He does a good job at explaining concepts. He lets the final replace the lowest test grade. Overall I loved this class
He explains everything really well. I'm usually bad at math but got an A in his class. Make sure to complete the study guides if you want to do well on tests.

He is extremely caring and thorough on how he teaches, he will go through multiple examples for the class to make sure everyone understands, very lenient with due dates on Aleks assignments, he wants everyone to be successful hands down recommend 10/10

You can easily tell that Professor Burnham is very caring and that he wants all of his students to succeed. I usually struggle with math, but he is a very good teacher. There is no busy work; all of his notes are exactly like the homework and the homework and study guides are extremely similar to the tests. You should definitely take his class!

He was a great teacher, and while I'm normally bad at math, I ended with an A in his class. As long as you show up, you'll pass. Tests are easy and you get notecards to help you, and he prepares study guides that are very similar to his tests.

Lectures are easy to follow, and he checks on everyone after every problem and will also answer any questions you have. Show up to all lectures as they are mandatory, hw is exactly like the lectures. Tests are also super similar. Nice, easygoing guy who answers his emails in a timely manner and will give hw extensions if you really need them.

The semester isn't over yet, but as I'm typing this I currently have an A in his class.

Professor Burnham is a likeable, funny, and caring. He understands life happens and will usually give extra time on assignments. Your notes are exactly like the homework, and the homework is exactly like your exam! TAKE HIM!!  extra credit on exams too.
